attributes.action: Prohibit any exams from taking place in the UK during the Covid-19 outbreak
attributes.additional_details: GCSE and A-Level students in the UK will now have teacher assessed grades. It will not be a level playing field for those who do iGCSE and iA Level. If they sit their exams during the summer, it will result in unfair competition for Sixth Form and University places due to having to compete with teacher assessed grades.
attributes.background: The government said that Summer exams will be cancelled due to loss of learning in Summer 2021. This does not include the UK students studying the iGCSE who have will be sitting the exams in May/June. I would like the Government to prohibit any exams take place, in the UK, during the COVID outbreak.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570228
